title: UT/UTCD Data Analyst [Level 3]
company: LIN SCAN Advanced Pipelines & Tanks Services
description:
PIPECARE is currently looking for a UT/UTCD Data Analyst [Level 3] to join our office at Noida office.

By providing technology and service-focused solutions to the international oil and gas industry, the PIPECARE Group of Companies has been helping customers ensure the integrity of their pipeline and facility assets for over 20 years. Due to our global presence and continuous growth, PIPECARE is seeking an experienced UT/UTCD Data Analyst [Level 3] to support our expanding operations.

Role Overview

The selected candidate will collaborate with our project execution teams to ensure the timely and accurate reporting of in-line inspection results. The role focuses on delivering custom-tailored reporting solutions that meet our customers‚Äô specific requirements. Responsibilities include reviewing customer requirement specifications, processing in-line inspection data, analyzing and identifying pipeline features and anomalies within processed datasets, applying industry-accepted anomaly assessment criteria, ensuring the quality and accuracy of final results, and compiling inspection findings into concise, comprehensive, customized reports for clients.

Industry/Sector

Oil & Gas / In-Line Inspection Services

Responsibilities Include
‚Ä¢ * Checking and approving the tool performance during the PTT
‚Ä¢ Checking the data quality of ILI runs
‚Ä¢ UTWM Data Analysis
‚Ä¢ UTCD Data Analysis
‚Ä¢ EMAT Data Analysis
‚Ä¢ Checking and implementing dig verification task at sites and preparing relevant reports
‚Ä¢ Reviewing the software inter phase
‚Ä¢ Reviewing software user manuals
‚Ä¢ Preparing/Reviewing DAD quality documentation
‚Ä¢ To ensure accurate tool sensitivity values are provided to TM in Tool Checklist
‚Ä¢ To prepare a specific Run assessment report
‚Ä¢ To identify obstructions in the pipeline; to produce technically valid Preliminary reports/ Final report (if applicable)
‚Ä¢ To produce technically valid Preliminary / Final report
‚Ä¢ To inform HO-DAD about the results and/or to implement the results into the reports
‚Ä¢ To ensure that the coordinates are synchronized with the data
‚Ä¢ To alert the R&D regarding software problems
‚Ä¢ To update the documentation
‚Ä¢ To produce updated standard quality procedures
‚Ä¢ To alert the DA Team Leader / DA Manager regarding software problems
‚Ä¢ Execute all other tasks as requested by DA Team Leader or DA Manager and/or Executive Team within the assigned job role.

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a technical or engineering field (minimum 4 years) from an accredited university; relevant experience in in-line inspection data analysis may be considered in lieu of formal education on a case-by-case basis
‚Ä¢ Certification as ILI PQ Level III Data Analyst in UTWM, UTCD, or EMAT (or ability to certify)
‚Ä¢ Minimum 5 years of experience as a UT/UTCD Data Analyst
‚Ä¢ Proficient in Microsoft applications; capable of learning proprietary software
‚Ä¢ Strong command of English (spoken and written)
‚Ä¢ High attention to detail, quality-driven, and professional demeanor
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and presentation skills across all organizational levels

Job Requirements
‚Ä¢ Ability to work extended periods at a workstation and pass vision acuity/color differentiation tests
‚Ä¢ Willingness to travel domestically and internationally for training, site visits, and customer meetings
‚Ä¢ Flexibility to adjust hours based on project needs and work independently or within a team

Physical And Mental Requirements
‚Ä¢ Lifting and Carrying: Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds.
‚Ä¢ Mobility: Must be able to walk and climb to perform duties, including maneuvering within a refinery or plant environment and accessing elevated platforms via ladders and stairwells.
‚Ä¢ Communication: Sufficient clarity of speech and hearing, or other communication capabilities, to communicate effectively.
‚Ä¢ Focus and Multitasking: Ability to maintain focus and multitask effectively.
‚Ä¢ Safety Equipment: Must be able to wear safety equipment as required by the safety department for personal protection, if/where needed in manufacturing environments.
‚Ä¢ Personal Mobility and Reflexes: Sufficient personal mobility and physical reflexes, with or without reasonable accommodations, to perform office duties and travel to off-site locations when necessary.

About PIPECARE Group

PIPECARE Group offers comprehensive In-Line Inspection Services to identify and size pipeline threats, Utilizing advanced technologies such as Magnetic Flux Leakage, Transverse Field Inspection, Ultrasound, and specialized tools, PIPECARE ensures precise detection and assessment of various pipeline anomalies.

What We Do

In-Line Inspection Services

PIPECARE provides In-Line Inspection Services to locate, identify, and size threats, supporting integrity management requirements.

Check out our AI Technology and other cutting-edge technologies by clicking the following YouTube Links:

PIPECARE Group - YouTube

SMART AI CALIPER - Inspection Experience Like Never Before

Inspection Technologies

Magnetic Flux Leakage (MFL): Detects and sizes general corrosion and metal loss anomalies, especially circumferentially oriented.

Transverse Field Inspection (TFI): Detects and sizes general corrosion and metal loss anomalies, primarily axially oriented.

Ultrasound (UT): Detects and sizes general and other metal loss anomalies with high depth sizing accuracy.

Ultrasonic Crack Detection: Detects and sizes cracks and colonies of cracks.

Caliper (Geometry): Detects and sizes deviations in the ideal circular shape of a pipeline (dents, ovalities, wrinkles, etc.).

Specialized Tools and Technologies

Combo Tools: Use multiple measurement systems in various combinations.

Specialized Tubing Technologies: Designed for Furnace and Downhole Operations.

Equal Opportunity Employer: We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Talent Manager Comment: Perfect for a Level 3 UT/UTCD Data Analyst with 5+ years in in-line inspection within the Oil & Gas sector. Requires ILI PQ Level III certification (or ability to certify) and expertise in UTWM, UTCD, and EMAT data analysis.

title: People Analytics Project Management & Data Analytics Lead
description:
Role: People Analytics Project Management & Data Analytics Lead

Location: Hyderabad

Summary

We are looking for a strategic and experienced in People Analytics domain Project Management & Data Analytics individual to lead and oversee enterprise-wide data-driven projects. This role is responsible for driving the execution of complex, high-impact analytics initiatives by combining strong project leadership with deep analytical thinking. The ideal candidate will play a key role in influencing data strategy, optimizing performance, and delivering business outcomes through actionable insights.

Key Responsibilities

Leadership & Strategy
‚Ä¢ Lead the development and execution of the data analytics project roadmap aligned with business priorities.
‚Ä¢ Act as a strategic advisor to senior leadership on analytics capability development and data-driven decision-making.
‚Ä¢ Champion a data-driven culture and partner with business leaders to drive adoption of insights.

Project & Program Management
‚Ä¢ Oversee multiple high-value analytics and digital transformation programs across departments.
‚Ä¢ Define program scope, milestones, budgets, risks, and governance structures.
‚Ä¢ Ensure timely delivery of projects, managing dependencies, and resolving conflicts across cross-functional teams.

Analytics Oversight
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with data science, BI, and engineering teams to deliver high-quality dashboards, models, and insights.
‚Ä¢ Translate complex analytical outcomes into executive-level narratives and business recommendations.
‚Ä¢ Monitor KPIs and ensure analytics projects deliver measurable business value.

Stakeholder Management
‚Ä¢ Build strong relationships with Digital, business units, and external partners.
‚Ä¢ Foster alignment between analytics initiatives and overall business transformation goals.

Required Skills & Experience
‚Ä¢ 10+ years of experience in project/program management, with 5+ years in data/analytics or digital transformation.
‚Ä¢ Proven leadership in managing cross-functional teams in a matrixed environment.
‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of data lifecycle, BI, and analytics tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.).
‚Ä¢ Strong business acumen with the ability to connect data initiatives to operational and financial outcomes.
‚Ä¢ Expertise in PM methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Lean, or PMI standards).
‚Ä¢ Exceptional communication, executive reporting, and stakeholder influencing skills.

Preferred Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Master‚Äôs degree in Analytics, Data Science, or related field (MBA a plus).
‚Ä¢ Experience in enterprise data platform rollouts, AI/ML adoption, or analytics center of excellence (CoE) models.
‚Ä¢ Industry knowledge in FMCG / Healthcare

title: Data Modelling + Data Analyst + Python
description:
Looking for a skilled and analytical Data Analyst with strong expertise in data modeling, data analysis, and Python programming. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing data models, performing in-depth analysis, and building automated solutions to support business decision-making and reporting.

Key Responsibilities

Design and implement conceptual, logical, and physical data models to support analytics and reporting.

Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.

Develop and maintain Python scripts for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Collaborate with data engineers, business analysts, and stakeholders to understand data requirements.

Create dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings effectively.

Ensure data quality, consistency, and integrity across systems.

Document data definitions, models, and analysis processes.

Required Skills & Qualifications

Strong experience in data modeling (ER diagrams, normalization, dimensional modeling).

Proficiency in Python for data analysis (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, etc.).

Solid understanding of SQL and relational databases.

Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, or matplotlib/seaborn).

Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.

Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Talent Manager Comment: Best suited for candidates skilled in data modeling, Python (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib), and SQL. Experience with data visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau is highly relevant. Analytical and problem-solving skills are crucial.

title: Sr Data Analyst
description:
As a Senior Data Analyst within the PMO, you will play a crucial role in developing and managing IT cost models to ensure the effective allocation, tracking, and reporting of IT expenses. Your responsibilities will involve collaborating with IT, finance, and business units to align cost models with company strategy, optimize IT spend, and analyze trends for informed decision-making and budgeting. By leveraging your expertise in financial analytics, IT cost modeling, and data-driven decision-making, you will influence technology spending and drive cost-efficient and scalable technology investments for the CIO organization.

Your key responsibilities will include designing, building, and maintaining detailed IT cost models, collaborating with IT teams to allocate costs accurately, performing variance and trend analysis on IT operational costs, assisting in the development of IT budgets and forecasts, creating regular cost reporting and dashboards, supporting IT financial planning through scenario analysis, and ensuring compliance with corporate governance and regulatory standards.

To qualify for this role, you should hold a Bachelor's degree in finance, Accounting, Information Systems, or a related field, along with 10+ years of experience in financial analysis, IT cost modeling, or related roles. Proficiency in financial modeling tools such as Excel, SQL, Power BI, and Tableau is essential, as well as familiarity with IT cost structures, budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting processes. Strong analytical skills, excellent communication abilities, and the capacity to work collaboratively across departments are also key qualifications.

Preferred skills include experience with IT financial management tools, knowledge of IT service management frameworks, familiarity with cloud financial management, and automation tools for cost optimization. By bringing your expertise to this role, you will contribute to driving effective cost management strategies and enabling strategic IT investments for the organization.,
Keywords: ["IT Cost Modeling","Financial Analysis","Data Analysis","Excel","SQL","Power BI","Tableau","Budgeting","Forecasting","Variance Analysis","IT Financial Management","Cost Optimization"]
Talent Manager Comment: Ideal for a senior professional with 10+ years of experience in financial analysis and IT cost modeling. Requires proficiency in Excel, SQL, Power BI, and Tableau, along with strong analytical and communication skills.

title: Reporting and Automation Data Analyst
description:
Senior Data and Automation Analyst II

Gurgaon/Bangalore, India

At AXA XL, we are transforming Human Resources. To keep AXA XL moving fast, fast forward, HR is changing our systems, processes, and policies to help our clients attract, engage, develop and retain the best talent globally. We are looking to bring on board a passionate Human Resources professional to help us in our journey.

What You‚Äôll Be DOING

What will your essential responsibilities include?
‚Ä¢ Develop Power BI dashboards by understanding Business specifications and translating them into automated modules wherever possible.
‚Ä¢ Collect, analyze, and interpret HR data to provide insights on workforce trends, employee engagement, retention rates, recruitment effectiveness etc.
‚Ä¢ Conduct predictive analytics to forecast future HR needs and trends.
‚Ä¢ Support the development and implementation of Americas HR initiatives based on data analysis
‚Ä¢ Present findings and recommendations to HR leadership and stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Oversee the day-to-day operations of BI & Reporting, and ensure effective stakeholder management.
‚Ä¢ Foster the growth of BI & Reporting talent, promoting inclusion and diversity to maximize the use and value of our strategic digital, data, and analytics assets.
‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain Power BI application automations.
‚Ä¢ Develop, maintain and automate the existing and new reporting requirements, keeping them standardized, but flexible enough to incorporate last minute changes and adjustment in fast moving reporting environment.
‚Ä¢ Manage the data extraction and report running out of various operational reporting tools and databases including MyHR, MyMove.
‚Ä¢ Ensure proper documentation and audit trail for all the reports prepared.
‚Ä¢ Responsible for supporting Annual and regular compliance reporting for the region
‚Ä¢ Importing and transferring data to a secure central database.
‚Ä¢ Responsible for accurate and insightful Analytics, and metrics within the BU.
‚Ä¢ Participate in Community of Practice and support data integrity initiatives.

You will report to Senior Human Resources Ops, Governance and Compliance Partner, Americas.

What You Will BRING

We‚Äôre looking for someone who has these abilities and skills:

Required Skills And Abilities
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field; a Master‚Äôs degree is a plus
‚Ä¢ Proven experience in HR analytics or a related field, with a excellent understanding of HR processes and metrics.
‚Ä¢ Proficient in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI).
‚Ä¢ Advanced knowledge of MS office tools like Excel (with Macros) & Access (Pivot, charts, slicers etc.) is a must. Should have delivered automations in the past.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Microsoft Power Platforms applications (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI), C++, Python, SQL and SharePoint is a must.
‚Ä¢ Excellent mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
‚Ä¢ Ability to read, interpret, and verify data from multiple formats.
‚Ä¢ Analytical and creative thinker with problem solving skills.

Desired Skills And Abilities
‚Ä¢ Effective attention to detail.
‚Ä¢ Ability to develop and produce meaningful reports from multiple streams of resources and data with a high degree of autonomy.
‚Ä¢ Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet tight deadlines.

Who WE are

AXA XL, the P&C and specialty risk division of AXA, is known for solving complex risks. For mid-sized companies, multinationals and even some inspirational individuals we don‚Äôt just provide re/insurance, we reinvent it.

How? By combining a comprehensive and efficient capital platform, data-driven insights, leading technology, and the best talent in an agile and inclusive workspace, empowered to deliver top client service across all our lines of business ‚àí property, casualty, professional, financial lines and specialty.

With an innovative and flexible approach to risk solutions, we partner with those who move the world forward.

Learn more at axaxl.com

What we OFFER

Inclusion

AXA XL is committed to equal employment opportunity and will consider applicants regardless of gender, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity and origins, marital status, religion, disability, or any other protected characteristic. At AXA XL, we know that an inclusive culture and enables business growth and is critical to our success. That‚Äôs why we have made a strategic commitment to attract, develop, advance and retain the most inclusive workforce possible, and create a culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and reach their highest potential. It‚Äôs about helping one another ‚Äî and our business ‚Äî to move forward and succeed.
‚Ä¢ Five Business Resource Groups focused on gender, LGBTQ+, ethnicity and origins, disability and inclusion with 20 Chapters around the globe.
‚Ä¢ Robust support for Flexible Working Arrangements
‚Ä¢ Enhanced family-friendly leave benefits
‚Ä¢ Named to the Diversity Best Practices Index
‚Ä¢ Signatory to the UK Women in Finance Charter

Learn more at axaxl.com/about-us/inclusion-and-diversity. AXA XL is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Total Rewards

AXA XL‚Äôs Reward program is designed to take care of what matters most to you, covering the full picture of your health, wellbeing, lifestyle and financial security. It provides competitive compensation and personalized, inclusive benefits that evolve as you do.

We‚Äôre committed to rewarding your contribution for the long term, so you can be your best self today and look forward to the future with confidence.

Sustainability

At AXA XL, Sustainability is integral to our business strategy. In an ever-changing world, AXA XL protects what matters most for our clients and communities. We know that sustainability is at the root of a more resilient future. Our 2023-26 Sustainability strategy, called ‚ÄúRoots of resilience‚Äù, focuses on protecting natural ecosystems, addressing climate change, and embedding sustainable practices across our operations.

Our Pillars
‚Ä¢ Valuing nature: How we impact nature affects how nature impacts us. Resilient ecosystems - the foundation of a sustainable planet and society - are essential to our future. We‚Äôre committed to protecting and restoring nature - from mangrove forests to the bees in our backyard - by increasing biodiversity awareness and inspiring clients and colleagues to put nature at the heart of their plans.
‚Ä¢ Addressing climate change: The effects of a changing climate are far-reaching and significant. Unpredictable weather, increasing temperatures, and rising sea levels cause both social inequalities and environmental disruption. We're building a net zero strategy, developing insurance products and services, and mobilizing to advance thought leadership and investment in societal-led solutions.
‚Ä¢ Integrating ESG: All companies have a role to play in building a more resilient future. Incorporating ESG considerations into our internal processes and practices builds resilience from the roots of our business. We‚Äôre training our colleagues, engaging our external partners, and evolving our sustainability governance and reporting.
‚Ä¢ AXA Hearts in Action: We have established volunteering and charitable giving programs to help colleagues support causes that matter most to them, known as AXA XL‚Äôs ‚ÄúHearts in Action‚Äù programs. These include our Matching Gifts program, Volunteering Leave, and our annual volunteering day - the Global Day of Giving.

For more information, please see axaxl.com/sustainability.

title: Analyst PTP Indexing
description:
PTP

Who we are?

Johnson Controls is the global leader for smart, healthy and sustainable buildings. At Johnson Controls, we‚Äôve been making buildings smarter since 1885, and our capabilities, depth of innovation experience, and global reach have been growing ever since. Today, we offer the world‚Äôs largest portfolio of building products, technologies, software, and services; we put that portfolio to work to transform the environments where people live, work, learn and play.

This is where Johnson Controls comes in, helping drive the outcomes that matter most. Through a full range of systems and digital solutions, we make your buildings smarter. A smarter building is safer, more comfortable, more efficient, and, ultimately, more sustainable. Most important, smarter buildings let you focus more intensely on your unique mission. Better for your people. Better for your bottom line. Better for the planet. We‚Äôre helping to create a healthy planet with solutions that decrease energy use, reduce waste and make carbon neutrality a reality. Sustainability is a top priority for our company.

We committed to invest 75 percent of new product development R&D in climate-related innovation to develop sustainable products and services. We take sustainability seriously. Achieving net zero carbon emissions before 2040 is just one of our commitments to making the world a better place.

Please visit and follow Johnson Controls LinkedIn for recent exciting activities.

What We Offer

In addition, we offer outstanding career development opportunities which will stretch your abilities and channel your talents

Diversity & Inclusion Our dedication to diversity and inclusion starts with our values. We lead with integrity and purpose, focusing on the future and aligning with our customers‚Äô vision for success. Our High-Performance Culture ensures that we have the best talent that is highly engaged and eager to innovate.‚ÄØ Our D&I mission elevates each employee‚Äôs responsibility to contribute to our culture. It‚Äôs through these contributions that we‚Äôll drive the mindsets and behaviors we need to power our customers‚Äô missions. You have the power. You have the voice. You have the culture in your hands.

Join EY and help to build a better working world.

At EY, you‚Äôll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture, and technology to become the best version of you. And we‚Äôre counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The opportunity

This is an opportunity to become part of the Global Talent Delivery Team responsible for ensuring alignment of talent solutions, processes, and data, enabling continuous improvement through digital enablement and deliver management information and predictive insights.

The successful candidate will join the Talent Insights and Analytics Team ‚Äì Data & Reporting Analysis, a key sub function, who will build key relationships, deliver reporting and analytics services to Talent teams globally.

Your Key Responsibilities

Essential Functions of the Job:
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with Talent Insights and Analytics - Business Consulting and Analytics & Planning teams to build and enable reporting services at scale.
‚Ä¢ Support the delivery of advanced and predictive reporting techniques to deliver robust analyses and support the delivery of insights to the Talent Executive teams.
‚Ä¢ Ensure consistent delivery of reports, compliance/ legal reporting, strategic reporting, ad-hoc analysis, technical / complex requests, SuccessFactors (SF) report development, management reporting / cross functional reports.
‚Ä¢ Configure and create new reporting and analysis to meet operational and management demands.
‚Ä¢ Deep subject matter expertise in data engineering, visualization, and related functional domains to generate and support insights and analysis.
‚Ä¢ Responsible for the delivery of reporting services via direct access and bespoke requests, leveraging both automation techniques and manual reporting.
‚Ä¢ Liaison with other groups such as vendors, IT, all other teams within Talent Delivery.
‚Ä¢ Understand and deliver complex, ad-hoc report analytics requests through leveraging analytics expertise.
‚Ä¢ Provide better managerial insights to stakeholders - through integrated and standardized data reports and dashboards.
‚Ä¢ Deliver on diverse requests spanning across SF configuration and reporting functionality, SQL, Power BI, advanced Excel, data configuration, storytelling etc.
‚Ä¢ Develop delivery expertise on the different technologies used in SF within Talent, liaising with different solution and process owners to ensure data availability.
‚Ä¢ Seek ways to automate standard reporting to aid and develop the reporting landscape.
‚Ä¢ Perform data analysis to assess quality and meaning of data, maintain database and data systems to ensure reorganization of data in a readable format.
‚Ä¢ Support and execute ongoing development of existing solutions by identifying and prioritizing needs, defining the requirements for third party delivery.

Analytical/Decision Making Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Provide delivery expertise and knowledge in how reporting and analysis operates. Understand the reporting landscape and optimize functional delivery standards.
‚Ä¢ For allocated processes support and implement decisions for defining, delivering, and continuously improving the process.
‚Ä¢ Leverage and review data and information to monitor reporting performance against agreed metrics. (e.g., timelines / efficiency of service delivery)
‚Ä¢ Share market insights and review findings with key stakeholders / networks influencing change as required.

Other Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with extended teams to ensure effective execution of technology implementation, drive quality and performance standards
‚Ä¢ Work closely with the teams across the Talent Delivery and wider Talent Functions for configuration, development, testing and implementation of technological solutions that support business and functional delivery.
‚Ä¢ Ability to develop people, skills in coaching, mentoring, and learning on the job
‚Ä¢ Effectiveness in building trust, respect, and cooperation among teams

Other Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Due to global nature of the role; travel and willingness to work alternative hours will be required
‚Ä¢ Due to global nature of the role; English language skills - excellent written and verbal communication will be required

Skills And Attributes For Success

Experience:
‚Ä¢ Experience in delivering functional reporting solutions for business
‚Ä¢ Experience on supporting reporting capabilities and its implementation (SAP, Oracle, SuccessFactors, custom solutions) in a relevant industry or consulting environment
‚Ä¢ Experience of having worked on reporting and analytics solutions and its delivery
‚Ä¢ Demonstrable experience of collaborating with talent colleagues to understand needs/requirements and of underlying reporting and data governance processes & systems
‚Ä¢ Experience of participating in global dispersed teams to enhance services, processes, and standards
‚Ä¢ Demonstrable experience of working in fast-paced, ambiguous, stressful environments to deliver required results
‚Ä¢ Demonstrable experience of working with third party vendors / external system implementors to deliver reporting solutions
‚Ä¢ Demonstrable experience of anticipating issues and challenges and proactively working to navigate challenges
‚Ä¢ Experience of conducting internal and external research and analysis, providing best practices and insights to drive improvements
‚Ä¢ Demonstrable experience of having worked in a collaborative environment or provide subject matter resource advice to achieve successful change outcomes

To qualify for the role, you must have
‚Ä¢ Bring deep knowledge of the reporting and analytics operating model, and organization design and ways of working across the talent eco-system.
‚Ä¢ Strong business acumen ‚Äì ability to understand Talent systems landscape and to consider the functionality and integration requirements in line with the capabilities required to implement reporting and data analytics priorities.
‚Ä¢ Ability to participate effectively in virtual teams and networks across diverse and dispersed geographies.
‚Ä¢ Proactive consulting skills that drive business impact; able to interpret functional / technological requirements and, where prioritized, co-create the most relevant & pragmatic approach.
‚Ä¢ Strong teaming skills; collaborate effectively across talent ecosystem, within the Talent Delivery team and the firm at-large.
‚Ä¢ Strong communication skills for sharing thought leadership across EY and externally to enhance EY reputation.
‚Ä¢ Strong organizational skills and attention to detail - the ability to operate within budget and effective time frames.
‚Ä¢ Strong research and analytical skills to track and interpret trending directions for designing the reporting and analytics solutions and to identify potential future options.
‚Ä¢ Significant ability to cope with ambiguity; to drive change and performance outcomes in a complex and agile environment.

Reporting, Analytics and Technical Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Reporting: Understanding and manipulating data and creating reports
‚Ä¢ Technical with 3-5 + years in the following:
‚Ä¢ SuccessFactors report development expertise (SF Report Stories, SF Canvas Reports), SF Plateau Report Designer
‚Ä¢ Excel (Advanced such as Power Query, VBA macro, etc.)
‚Ä¢ SQL, SSIS, SMS, SSRS, ETL, Relational Database, Data modeling
‚Ä¢ Intermediate SQL skills to develop and optimize complex queries for data extraction using aggregate functions, CTEs, Windows functions etc.
‚Ä¢ Experience with data manipulation and transformation including creation of SQL tables, views and stored procedures.
‚Ä¢ Experience developing and optimizing SSIS packages for data integration and transformation tasks
‚Ä¢ Visualization/Dashboards: Microsoft Power BI
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of data science tools such as Phyton and R
‚Ä¢ MS Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with AI platforms

Ideally, you‚Äôll also have

Functional Experience:
‚Ä¢ 3-5 + years or more of professional experience working in HR Services ‚Äì Data Analyst/ Reporting or Operations domain
‚Ä¢ Experience with HR processes, such as Performance Management, and reporting,
‚Ä¢ Experience in HR technologies (such as SF Employee Central, SF Performance Management or similar product)
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of EY's LEAD PPEDD and Non-PPEDD Performance review process
‚Ä¢ Experience in development, administration and management of all workbooks and reports required in the performance process, including LEAD Review Workbook (LRW)
‚Ä¢ Experienced in development and management of "feeds" from various sources into the Talent Insights and Analytics - Performance database.
‚Ä¢ Experience in development of SuccessFactors LEAD reports
‚Ä¢ Analysis experience on talent metrics (such as employee performance)

Education:
‚Ä¢ Educated to degree level
‚Ä¢ Higher professional or master‚Äôs qualification is preferred, not required

Certification Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Higher professional or master‚Äôs qualification in a related discipline is preferred, not required
‚Ä¢ Active membership in related professional bodies or industry groups is preferred, not required

What We Look For

Talent Insights and Analytics ‚Äì Data & Reporting Analysis team is looking for an individual with the skills and experience we require, who can work well with our team, takes charge of their personal development, and go above and beyond expectations to help EY build a better working world.

What We Offer

As part of this role, you'll work in a highly integrated, global team with the opportunity and tools to grow, develop and drive your career forward. Here, you can combine global opportunity with flexible working. The EY benefits package goes above and beyond too, focusing on your physical, emotional, financial, and social well-being. Your recruiter can talk to you about the benefits available in your country. Here‚Äôs a snapshot of what we offer:
‚Ä¢ Continuous learning: You‚Äôll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
‚Ä¢ Success as defined by you: We‚Äôll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
‚Ä¢ Transformative leadership: We‚Äôll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
‚Ä¢ Diverse and inclusive culture: You‚Äôll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

Please apply to this role only through the ‚ÄòApply‚Äô link (not through the local office). Your application will then be routed to the appropriate recruiting team.

The Exceptional EY Experience. It‚Äôs Yours To Build.

EY | Building a better working world

EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.

Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.

EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.

title: Data Analyst / Analytics Engineer
description:
Data Analyst / Analytics Engineer - Client Analytics and Strategy Team, AVP
Job Description:

Job Title - Data Analyst / Analytics Engineer - Client Analytics and Strategy Team, AVP

Location - Mumbai, India

Role Description
‚Ä¢ The Client and Sales Analytics Specialist develops and manages the end-to-end process of delivering the analytics around revenue, pipeline, KPIs etc to stakeholders, bringing transparency to the Corporate Bank Leadership teams as well as the Coverage and Sales organisations on our top client relationships. The role requires a holistic understanding of internal and external client data, along with the ability to distill and communicate a contextualized narrative with actionable insights to a wide audience. As part of the Client Analytics squad and in collaboration with all stakeholders, the role will support the build out, training and provide ongoing support to colleagues across the Corporate Bank.

What we‚Äôll offer you

As part of our flexible scheme, here are just some of the benefits that you‚Äôll enjoy
‚Ä¢ Best in class leave policy
‚Ä¢ Gender neutral parental leaves
‚Ä¢ 100% reimbursement under childcare assistance benefit (gender neutral)
‚Ä¢ Sponsorship for Industry relevant certifications and education
‚Ä¢ Employee Assistance Program for you and your family members
‚Ä¢ Comprehensive Hospitalization Insurance for you and your dependents
‚Ä¢ Accident and Term life Insurance
‚Ä¢ Complementary Health screening for 35 yrs. and above

Your key responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Production, enhancement, maintenance of Global MI related to the Corporate Bank,
‚Ä¢ Data quality controls, enabling translation / transformation of data to stitch together disparate data sources and drive data clean-up
‚Ä¢ Consolidate different datasets to fabricate essential client insights
‚Ä¢ Drive effort of integrating analytics into strategic platforms and other relevant forums
‚Ä¢ Support the business by building and deploying value-added MI and Dashboards
‚Ä¢ Support audit and regulatory requests by provided data after validation and aggregation
‚Ä¢ Support Management teams with investigations, deep dives and adhoc analysis

Your skills and experience
‚Ä¢ Experience in Analytical tools such as Tableau and SQL
‚Ä¢ 7+ years of experience in data visualization (preferably Tableau)
‚Ä¢ Design and build Tableau dashboards
‚Ä¢ Be hands-on and very familiar with complex SQL
‚Ä¢ Understand data modelling and data warehouse designs
‚Ä¢ Data modeling: from raw data, to building report and eventually deployment of dashboards
‚Ä¢ Be able to do required changes on database level (design and build new tables, views etc.)
‚Ä¢ Strong MI background with high data interpretation skills
‚Ä¢ Work with users to understand business requirements and design solutions
‚Ä¢ Strong interpersonal skills, communication, stakeholder management & teamwork
‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently and under tight deadlines
‚Ä¢ Relevant experience in the banking sector

How we‚Äôll support you
‚Ä¢ Training and development to help you excel in your career
‚Ä¢ Coaching and support from experts in your team
‚Ä¢ A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
‚Ä¢ A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs

About us and our teams

Please visit our company website for further information:

https://www.db.com/company/company.htm

We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.

Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.

We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.

Executive Level

title: Senior Data Analyst - GTM Analytics
description:
Would you like to be part of an exciting journey that is shaping the way businesses and industry are using data? Are you excited by the prospect of analyzing data, finding hidden trends and designing compelling visuals to tell the right story? Then write to us. The Go-To-Market Data and Analytics team is looking for talented individuals like you.

About the Role:

The ideal candidate is someone who can:
‚Ä¢ Be a self-starter with a curiosity to explore large volumes of data and have the patience to extract, prepare and scrub data for analysis
‚Ä¢ Have the curiosity to interrogate data, conduct independent research, utilize various techniques to analyze it and, if need be, tackle ambiguous problems with maturity
‚Ä¢ Work with various business stakeholders, understand their individual needs and design custom dashboards
‚Ä¢ Derive business insights and make recommendations
‚Ä¢ Work well within a team and can collaborate with colleagues across domains and geographies
‚Ä¢ Develop a sound understanding of each business and its processes, reconcile those with probable KPIs and derive insights
‚Ä¢ Conduct walk-through meetings with stakeholders

About You:
‚Ä¢ 5-6 years of Tableau/BI development experience with expertise in building high-quality dashboards
‚Ä¢ Strong SQL knowledge and experience with Alteryx workflows
‚Ä¢ Experience with data wrangling from platforms like Eloqua, Salesforce, and Enterprise Data Warehouses
‚Ä¢ Previous Marketing and Sales data experience
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of databases, data warehouses, and data modeling
‚Ä¢ Excellent visual communication with deep understanding of data visualization best practices
‚Ä¢ Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills
‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate complex results simply to all organizational levels
‚Ä¢ Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
‚Ä¢ Graduate degree (STEM background preferred)
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills and team player attitude
‚Ä¢ Ability to thrive in fast-paced environments
‚Ä¢ Quick learner with emotional maturity and ability to work under pressure

#LI-GS1

What‚Äôs in it For You?
‚Ä¢ Hybrid Work Model: We‚Äôve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
‚Ä¢ Flexibility & Work-Life Balance: Flex My Way is a set of supportive workplace policies designed to help manage personal and professional responsibilities, whether caring for family, giving back to the community, or finding time to refresh and reset. This builds upon our flexible work arrangements, including work from anywhere for up to 8 weeks per year, empowering employees to achieve a better work-life balance.
‚Ä¢ Career Development and Growth: By fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development, we prepare our talent to tackle tomorrow‚Äôs challenges and deliver real-world solutions. Our Grow My Way programming and skills-first approach ensures you have the tools and knowledge to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future.
‚Ä¢ Industry Competitive Benefits: We offer comprehensive benefit plans to include flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days off, access to the Headspace app, retirement savings, tuition reimbursement, employee incentive programs, and resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
‚Ä¢ Culture: Globally recognized, award-winning reputation for inclusion and belonging, flexibility, work-life balance, and more. We live by our values: Obsess over our Customers, Compete to Win, Challenge (Y)our Thinking, Act Fast / Learn Fast, and Stronger Together.
‚Ä¢ Social Impact: Make an impact in your community with our Social Impact Institute. We offer employees two paid volunteer days off annually and opportunities to get involved with pro-bono consulting projects and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives.
‚Ä¢ Making a Real-World Impact:‚ÄØWe are one of the few companies globally that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

About Us

Thomson Reuters informs the way forward by bringing together the trusted content and technology that people and organizations need to make the right decisions. We serve professionals across legal, tax, accounting, compliance, government, and media. Our products combine highly specialized software and insights to empower professionals with the data, intelligence, and solutions needed to make informed decisions, and to help institutions in their pursuit of justice, truth, and transparency. Reuters, part of Thomson Reuters, is a world leading provider of trusted journalism and news.

We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness, and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

As a global business, we rely on the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of all employees to deliver on our business goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law. More information on requesting an accommodation here.

Learn more on how to protect yourself from fraudulent job postings here.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.
